item.title: Malaysia Says TikTok Not in Full Compliance With Its Laws
item.description: China-owned social-media platform TikTok isn’t in full compliance with Malaysian laws and needs to do more to curb the spread of defamatory and misleading content in the country, a Malaysian minister said.

item.title: Sterling Little Moved After UK GDP Data
item.description: Sterling was little changed after the latest GDP data was in line with consensus, with Monex Europe saying the reading “is unlikely to encourage a change of stance from the BOE, with policymakers having recently paused their hiking cycle signalling a high-for-longer stance.”

item.title: What Is Hamas? What to Know About the Militant Group Fighting Israel
item.description: Hamas upended the stability of the entire Middle East when its fighters surged into Israel from the Gaza Strip. What exactly are its objectives?

item.title: EasyJet Warns of Profit Miss
item.description: EasyJet said it expected to report a headline pretax profit for fiscal 2023 of £440-460 million, missing consensus, but said it would reinstate dividends after fourth-quarter profit rose.

item.title: 7-Eleven Owner's First-Half Profit Falls on Weak Overseas Business
item.description: Seven & i Holdings said its first-half net profit fell due to weakness in its 7-Eleven convenience stores overseas and losses related to the sale of its department-store business.

item.title: German Bunds Remain Supported Amid Geopolitical Risks
item.description: While U.S. CPI data should underscore that inflation is still noticeably above target, weaker oil, flows and geopolitical risks keep Bunds supported, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: Uniqlo Owner's Profit Rises to Record High
item.description: Fast Retailing said fiscal-year net profit climbed to a record high thanks to stronger sales at its Uniqlo outlets globally.

item.title: U.K. Economy Returns to Growth as Expected
item.description: The U.K.’s GDP rose 0.2% in August, in line with forecasts, driven by output in the services sector.

item.title: Givaudan Ups Prices Further as Sales Pressured
item.description: Givaudan reported a decline in sales to CHF1.7 billion in the third quarter, and said it continued to implement price increases to offset higher costs.

item.title: Publicis Upgrades Outlook as Sales Top Hopes
item.description: Publicis raised its guidance for the second time this year after third-quarter organic revenue growth beat expectations, saying market-share gains allowed it to offset a challenging economic backdrop.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 1.75% on Rising Prospects for a Fed Pause
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average rose 1.75% to close at 32494.66 on rising prospects for a Fed pause.

item.title: Hollywood Studios Suspend Talks With Actors
item.description: The breakdown of negotiations after less than two weeks dampens hopes that the industry could soon return to work.

item.title: Albemarle's Liontown Deal the Latest Threatened by Assertive Shareholders
item.description: Albemarle’s proposed $4.24 billion takeover of Australian lithium miner Liontown Resources is the latest in a flurry of multibillion-dollar deals to hit a hurdle in the form of assertive shareholders.

item.title: Luyuan, Shiyuan Daotian Shares Rise in Hong Kong Debut
item.description: Shares of Luyuan Group Holding and Shiyue Daotian Group rose in their trading debut in Hong Kong amid hopes that the IPO market may be recovering.

item.title: Facing Exclusion From U.S., Chinese EV Suppliers Map a Circuitous Route Back In
item.description: Battery makers’ path around legal barriers runs through South Korea and Morocco.

item.title: Billionaire Bets That a $12 Mobile Phone Can Get More of the World's Most-Populous Country Online
item.description: Smartphones are financially out of reach for millions of people in India. Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Jio Infocomm’s new device can stream music and video.

item.title: Goldman Sachs agreed to sell specialty lender GreenSky to a group of investors, a major step in what has become a costly retreat from the bank's ambitions to serve a broader consumer market.
item.description: Goldman Sachs agreed to sell specialty lender GreenSky to a group of investors, a major step in what has become a costly retreat from the bank’s ambitions to serve a broader consumer market.

item.title: Exxon Mobil struck a nearly $60 billion agreement to buy Pioneer Natural Resources in the largest oil-and-gas deal in two decades, tying the energy giant's future to fossil fuels.
item.description: Exxon Mobil struck a nearly $60 billion agreement to buy Pioneer Natural Resources in the largest oil-and-gas deal in two decades, tying the energy giant’s future to fossil fuels.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 0.4%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 0.4%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.

item.title: Saturday's attack upended fundamental assumptions about the Middle East and the new, untested rules risk turning the bloody confrontation between Israel and Hamas into a much wider war.
item.description: Saturday’s attack upended fundamental assumptions about the Middle East and the new, untested rules risk turning the bloody confrontation between Israel and Hamas into a much wider war.
